decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board by playing disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Sundering Eruption, while also quickly ramping up its mana with Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck aims to curve out with powerful threats like Pyrogoyf and Laelia, the Blade Reforged, supported by efficient burn spells like Shatterskull Smashing and Fury. The inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Broadside Bombardiers further enhances its aggressive game plan, making it a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells while utilizing mana acceleration and land destruction to gain an advantage. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with Thought-Knot Seer and other disruptive creatures, while quickly deploying big threats like It That Heralds the End to close out the game. The deck also takes advantage of powerful lands like Eye of Ugin and Cavern of Souls to make its creatures uncounterable and more difficult to deal with.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently combo off using Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Narcomoeba to mill the library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck also utilizes card selection and protection with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, Force of Will, and Teferi, Time Raveler. Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key combo pieces while Swords to Plowshares provides removal. The mana base is designed to support the combo while also incorporating some utility lands for added flexibility.

This deck focuses on using various reanimation spells such as Reanimate and Animate Dead to quickly bring powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Daze and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's resources and protect its combo pieces. The deck features a mix of card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in finding key pieces. The land base includes both dual lands and fetch lands for mana fixing and deck thinning. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly assembling a powerful creature and overwhelming the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by manipulating the opponent's actions through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It is designed to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also developing its own board presence with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student serves as a value engine while cards like Daze and Force of Will can protect your own spells. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolored spells, allowing for flexibility in casting powerful cards.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void. It includes mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, as well as utility lands like Eye of Ugin and Wasteland to control the board. The key strategy is to quickly overwhelm opponents with efficient threats while using disruption and mana denial to maintain board control. The deck aims to quickly close out games before opponents can establish their own game plan.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Reality Smasher, Thought-Knot Seer, and Glaring Fleshraker to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Chalice of the Void and Wasteland help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb allow for fast mana acceleration. The deck also includes powerful spells like Kozilek's Command and Once Upon a Time to maintain board presence and control the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Orcish Bowmasters to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes tools like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats from the opponent. Green Sun's Zenith and Once Upon a Time help with consistency in finding key creatures. The deck also includes cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Endurance for added versatility and disruption. The mana base consists of various dual lands and fetch lands to ensure smooth mana development. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using Mystic Forge to cast spells directly from the top of the library, while generating infinite mana with Grim Monolith and Basalt Monolith. This allows for explosive plays and combos with Paradox Engine and Urza's Saga. The deck also includes cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key to untap artifacts and generate more value. Karn, the Great Creator is used to search for additional artifacts while controlling the board. Overall, the deck aims to assemble key pieces quickly to create a powerful board state and win the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Delighted Halfling and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to generate a powerful card draw engine. It utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Green Sun's Zenith to find and set up the combo pieces quickly. Control elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares help protect the combo and disrupt opponents. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional protection and interaction with opponent's spells. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's requirements for various colors and land types.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill out the opponent's entire deck in one turn. Using cards like Goblin Engineer to tutor for combo pieces and disruption spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast, the deck looks to control the game until it can execute its combo. Urza's Saga helps find key artifacts like Grindstone, while Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors provide efficient mana acceleration. Overall, the strategy focuses on setting up a quick win condition while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's deck. The deck includes support cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to help find and recur key pieces, as well as disruption spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo. Additionally, cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal provide fast mana acceleration, while cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Agatha's Soul Cauldron help control the board. Overall, the deck aims to quickly and efficiently execute its combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent. It utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial to cheat out powerful creatures quickly, while also having access to removal and protection spells like Swords to Plowshares and Mother of Runes. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up its own board presence, with the ability to generate card advantage through synergies like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in longer games.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently through the synergy of various Elf creatures and lands like Gaea's Cradle, then use that mana to tutor for and play powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth or Grist, the Hunger Tide. The deck also includes protection and card advantage elements to ensure consistency and resilience against opposing strategies. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with an explosive combo turn that can quickly end the game in your favor.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Nadu, Winged Wisdom combo alongside Nomads en-Kor to draw through the deck quickly and efficiently. The deck also incorporates control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler to provide added value and flexibility. The mana base is designed to support the combo while also providing access to the necessary colors for the deck's spells and abilities.

The focus of this UWx control deck is to control the board using powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of the Skies, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will. The deck also utilizes card advantage and card filtering with cards like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provides a win condition while Teferi, Time Raveler helps to bounce problematic permanents. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures and then use cards like Balustrade Spy to mill the entire library, allowing Thassa's Oracle to win the game with its ability. The deck also includes various ways to generate mana quickly, protect your combo with cards like Pact of Negation, and bring back key cards from the graveyard. Overall, the goal is to execute a powerful combo win condition efficiently and swiftly, utilizing all your spells to do so.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token, while utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Knight of the Reliquary to find the necessary pieces. It also includes cards like Life from the Loam and Mox Diamond for mana acceleration and card advantage, as well as disruptive elements like Swords to Plowshares and Endurance for protection. The deck aims to quickly set up its combo while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats to pressure them, aiming to control the pace of the game and maintain tempo advantage. It includes a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its own threats. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower, along with card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes a mix of fetchlands and dual lands for color fixing.

This deck focuses on controlling the tempo of the game through disruption and efficient creatures. It aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will while also maintaining card advantage with Brainstorm and Ponder. The aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf pressure the opponent while providing card advantage. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember. By efficiently disrupting the opponent's strategy and deploying threats, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on deploying aggressive Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently, disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to ramp into powerful threats like It That Heralds the End. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its fast and powerful creatures, while also disrupting their game plan with control elements like Territory Culler and Kozilek's Command.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It focuses on using cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, Swords to Plowshares, and Counterbalance to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own strategy. Additionally, the deck utilizes card draw with Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as recursion with Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of unique cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Brainsurge adds versatility and power to the deck's control elements.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro Legacy deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupt their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize. The deck also includes powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Sorin of House Markov to close out games. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Dark Ritual and Chrome Mox to ramp out threats early and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Nihil Spellbomb provides some disruption against opposing strategies as well. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill opponents' decks quickly. With support from cards like Blood Moon and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while assembling its own win condition. Additional cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer provide utility to the deck, with access to powerful artifacts like Ensnaring Bridge and The Underworld Cookbook. Through efficient mana acceleration and disruptive elements, the deck aims to control the game and win through its powerful combo.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by controlling the board with cards like Smallpox, Thoughtseize, and Sinkhole. It also utilizes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Karn, the Great Creator to generate advantage and further hinder the opponent's strategy. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland combo allows for land destruction, while Urza's Saga helps tutor for key artifacts. The deck aims to grind out wins by overwhelming the opponent with control elements and resource denial.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to use aggressive creatures like Troll of Khazad-dm, Pyrogoyf, and Barrowgoyf to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with high-powered creatures while also preventing them from effectively stopping the aggro strategy through disruption and land destruction. The inclusion of cards like Reanimate and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker add versatility and potential for explosive plays.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly put powerful creatures onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The key strategy is to cheat in Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or other high-impact creatures, overwhelming the opponent with their power. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect its combo pieces and ensure its game plan goes off smoothly. With a mix of acceleration, card draw, and counterspells, this deck aims to win the game swiftly and decisively with its combo pieces.

The deck focuses on using Show and Tell to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Archon of Cruelty into play. It also utilizes cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience to cheat big creatures onto the battlefield. The deck includes various ways to protect these combo pieces, such as Force of Will and Veil of Summer. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and win before they have a chance to respond effectively. The deck also includes some card draw and mana acceleration to help set up its combos efficiently.

This deck aims to control the game by using a variety of creatures with enter-the-battlefield abilities, along with a package of equipment for power-ups. The key strategy involves bouncing these creatures back to hand or exiling them temporarily to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the help of Aether Vial, the deck can quickly deploy threats and protect them with counterspells like Meddling Mage. The versatile land base allows for mana fixing and disrupting the opponent's resources with Wasteland. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent through resource management and efficient creature interactions.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Dark Ritual, and using various cantrips and discard spells to dig for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to eventually cast a large Tendrils of Agony or use Burning Wish to find it to deal lethal damage in a single turn. The deck also includes protection in the form of Veil of Summer and Gaea's Will to ensure the combo can go off smoothly without interference.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. By utilizing powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with threats that are difficult to deal with. The combination of card draw, disruption, and graveyard manipulation allows the deck to execute its game plan efficiently and consistently, making it a formidable force in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then use spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a game-winning combo. It also includes disruption spells like Daze and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and control the opponent's strategy. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with fetch lands like Polluted Delta and Underground Sea providing access to all necessary colors. The deck is designed to win quickly and decisively through powerful reanimation combos.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. By combining reanimation spells with disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to cheat big threats into play ahead of schedule, overwhelming the opponent with high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. With efficient removal options in Fatal Push and disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, the deck seeks to control the game while setting up devastating combos to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bringing them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces and control the game. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate large threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while using counterspells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then use Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a fast win. The deck also includes disruption and control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's plays. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate high-impact creatures while maintaining enough control to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's plans.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently use reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to cheat powerful threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play early on. The deck combines disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces while also using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm to set up the perfect reanimation targets. With a mix of threats and disruption, this combo-reanimator deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory before they have a chance to recover.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful creatures, then bring them back to the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo pieces, as well as disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures and control spells, all while using cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key pieces of your combo.

This UWx Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a variety of removal spells, counter magic, and card draw. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the board and limit the opponent's resources. Cards like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will provide efficient answers to threats, while tools like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for key cards. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Back to Basics and Supreme Verdict to handle problematic strategies and stabilize the board.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will, while also deploying powerful threats like Recruiter of the Guard and Gilded Drake to apply pressure. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while providing access to important colors for spells and creatures.
